post: #OTD October 14, 1774, the Declaration and Resolves of the First Continental Congress was adopted. The statement outlined the colonists' grievances against the British Parliament's Intolerable Acts. Within their grievances, the colonists outlined rights that would evolve into the Bill of Rights. The colonists debated on how to confront the parliamentary acts placed on them by Britain. Including a plan of action, with acts such as boycotting British trade, sending a petition to the King, and publishing addresses, the Declaration and Resolves came to fruition.  https://lnkd.in/eKZiS9kH

BRI has established the Gary Colletti Scholarship for NCSS Attendees. Gary Colletti was a devoted educator who left a lasting legacy among the many teachers and students he helped support. The Bill of Rights Institute is ensuring Collettis legacy continues through the establishment of the Gary Colletti Conference Scholarship, and will offer the first cohort of awards for the 2024 National Council for the Social Studies Annual Conference. Colletti, a former classroom teacher in New York and Virginia, served as BRIs Director of Teacher and Student Programs before passing away in 2021. He was beloved by students and educators, and meeting fellow teachers at the annual NCSS conference was always one of the highlights of his year. Read more about the Gary Colletti Scholarship at  https://lnkd.in/ecXQWCKc  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI

School debate should be free, fair, and honest, where all students and viewpoints are welcome. Incubate Debate's first competitive tournament of the season, Incubate.
